member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Util.SessionUtil
member.summary: Class to provide support for working with Session objects.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Util.SessionUtil.GetDestination(Apache.NMS.ISession,System.String)
member.summary: Get the destination by parsing the embedded type prefix. Default is Queue if no prefix is embedded in the destinationName.
member.param: Session object to use to get the destination.

Name of destination with embedded prefix. The embedded prefix can be one of the following:
queue://
topic://
temp-queue://
temp-topic://

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Util.SessionUtil.GetDestination(Apache.NMS.ISession,System.String,Apache.NMS.DestinationType)
member.summary: Get the destination by parsing the embedded type prefix.
member.param: Session object to use to get the destination.

Name of destination with embedded prefix. The embedded prefix can be one of the following:
queue://
topic://
temp-queue://
temp-topic://
Default type if no embedded prefix is specified.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.Util.URISupport
member.summary: Class to provide support for Uri query parameters which uses .Net reflection to identify and set properties.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Util.URISupport.ParseQuery(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a Uri query string of the form ?x=y&z=0 into a map of name/value pairs.
member.param: The query string to parse. This string should not contain Uri escape characters.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.Util.URISupport.SetProperties(System.Object,System.Collections.Specialized.StringDictionary,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the public properties of a target object using a string map. This method uses .Net reflection to identify public properties of the target object matching the keys from the passed map.
member.param: The object whose properties will be set.
Key value prefix. This is prepended to the property name before searching for a matching key value.

member.summary: If using client acknowledgement mode on the session, then this method will acknowledge that the message has been processed correctly.

member.summary: Provides access to the message properties (headers).

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSCorrelationID
member.summary: The correlation ID used to correlate messages from conversations or long running business processes.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSDestination
member.summary: The destination of the message. This property is set by the IMessageProducer.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSTimeToLive
member.summary: The amount of time for which this message is valid. Zero if this message does not expire.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSMessageId
member.summary: The message ID which is set by the provider.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSPersistent
member.summary: Whether or not this message is persistent.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSPriority
member.summary: The Priority of this message.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSRedelivered
member.summary: Returns true if this message has been redelivered to this or another consumer before being acknowledged successfully.

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSReplyTo
member.summary: The destination that the consumer of this message should send replies to

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSTimestamp
member.summary: The timestamp of when the message was pubished in UTC time. If the publisher disables setting the timestamp on the message, the time will be set to the start of the UNIX epoc (1970-01-01 00:00:00).

member.name: P:Apache.NMS.IMessage.NMSType
member.summary: The type name of this message.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.AcknowledgementMode
member.summary: The mode used to acknowledge messages after they are consumed

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.AcknowledgementMode.AutoAcknowledge
member.summary: With this acknowledgment mode, the session will not acknowledge receipt of a message since the broker assumes successful receipt of a message after the onMessage handler has returned without error.

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.AcknowledgementMode.DupsOkAcknowledge
member.summary: With this acknowledgment mode, the session automatically acknowledges a client's receipt of a message either when the session has successfully returned from a call to receive or when the message listener the session has called to process the message successfully returns. Acknowlegements may be delayed in this mode to increase performance at the cost of the message being redelivered this client fails.

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.AcknowledgementMode.ClientAcknowledge
member.summary: With this acknowledgment mode, the client acknowledges a consumed message by calling the message's acknowledge method.

member.name: F:Apache.NMS.AcknowledgementMode.Transactional
member.summary: Messages will be consumed when the transaction commits.

member.summary: Waits until a message is available and returns it

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.IMessageConsumer.Receive(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: If a message is available within the timeout duration it is returned otherwise this method returns null

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.IMessageConsumer.ReceiveNoWait
member.summary: If a message is available immediately it is returned otherwise this method returns null

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.IMessageConsumer.Close
member.summary: Closes the message consumer.
member.remarks: Clients should close message consumers them when they are not needed. This call blocks until a receive or message listener in progress has completed. A blocked message consumer receive call returns null when this message consumer is closed.

member.summary: An asynchronous listener which can be used to consume messages asynchronously

member.summary: Represents a text based message

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.ITopic
member.summary: Represents a topic in a message broker. A message sent to a topic is delivered to all consumers on the topic who are interested in the message.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.ITrace
member.summary: The ITrace interface is used internally by ActiveMQ to log messages. The client aplication may provide an implementation of ITrace if it wishes to route messages to a specific destination.

remarks.para: Use the class to register an instance of ITrace as the active trace destination.

member.name: T:Apache.NMS.NMSConnectionException

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.NMSConnectionFactory.#ctor(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: The ConnectionFactory object must define a constructor that takes as a minimum a Uri object. Any additional parameters are optional, but will typically include a Client ID string.

member.summary: The ConnectionFactory object must define a constructor that takes as a minimum a Uri object. Any additional parameters are optional, but will typically include a Client ID string.

member.summary: Create a connection factory that can create connections for the given scheme in the URI.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.NMSConnectionFactory.GetTypeForScheme(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the Type associated with the given scheme.

member.name: M:Apache.NMS.NMSConnectionFactory.LookupConnectionFactoryInfo(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary:
Lookup the connection factory assembly filename and class name. Read an external configuration file that maps scheme to provider implementation. Load XML config files named: nmsprovider-{scheme}.config Following is a sample configuration file named nmsprovider-jms.config. Replace the parenthesis with angle brackets for proper XML formatting.
(?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?) (configuration) (provider assembly="MyCompany.NMS.JMSProvider.dll" classFactory="MyCompany.NMS.JMSProvider.ConnectionFactory"/) (/configuration)
This configuration file would be loaded and parsed when a connection uri with a scheme of 'jms' is used for the provider. In this example the connection string might look like: jms://localhost:7222

member.summary: Create an object array containing the parameters to pass to the constructor.
